title: Marc Chagall and His Times (Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Marc Chagall and His Times
Stanford University | 2004 | ISBN 0804742138 | English | 1058 pages | PDF | 89.4 MB

This book presents a new and comprehensive biography of one of the most prominent artists of the twentieth century in dialogue with the events and ideologies of his time. It encompasses the 98 years of Chagallâ€™s life (1887-1985) in Russia, France, the US, as well as Germany and Israel, his deep roots in folk culture, his personal relationships and loves, his involvement with the art of the Russian Revolution, with Surrealism, Communism, Zionism, Yiddish literature and the state of Israel. The book exposes the complex relationships between Chagallâ€™s three cultural identities: Jewish-Russian-French. Indeed, it is a biography of the turbulent times of the twentieth century and the transformations of a Jew in it, his meteoric rise from the â€œghettoâ€ of the Russian Pale of Settlement to the centers of modern culture
